Group work
Group work is one of the group-based learning methods. Participants are divided 
into small groups of 6 – 8 persons to exchange their views. Situations or problems 
may  be given to them. Their tasks involve discussing the situation/problem and coming up with solutions or recommendations. This exercise helps in improving the communication and analytical skills of the participants and brings out new 
ideas. Each group can be assigned one task at a time, which must be realistic 
and relevant to the training. Usually, group leaders are nominated to maintain the proceedings.
